Quickstart
  • <Click> a cue button to play it
  • <Right-Click> a cue button to queue it
  • [Spacebar] to play all queued cues
  • [Backspace] to stop all playing cues
  • [Shift + Backspace] to stop all playing & clear all queued cues
  • [Tab] to search for a cue
Opening a Project

To open a project, use the menu File > Open Project… and select the folder containing the project you'd like to open.

Synthea keeps a Projects Folder for storing projects you create, and all projects in this folder can be seen in the Projects menu. Select any project from the menu to open it.

NOTE: Newly-created and deleted projects will not be updated in the Projects menu until after Synthea restarts.

You can browse the Projects Folder directly by selecting Projects > Go to Projects Folder, and you can change the Projects Folder by selecting Projects > Change Projects Folder…

The Synthea Soundboard

When you open a project, you'll see the main Synthea soundboard layout.

Title Bar
The title of the project is here, and on the right you can toggle board settings.
  • Fade In: whether cues automatically fade in or play at full volume.
Page Selector
All of the projects pages are listed here, <click> on any to see the cues on that page or use arrow [left] and [right] to navigate between pages.
Section
Each page is divided into sections, and each section holds a selection of cues.
Cue
Click or right-click on a cue to play, pause, queue, or unqueue playback of a sound cue.
  • <Click> to play
  • <Right-Click> to queue
  • (Queued) <Right-Click> to unqueue
  • (Playing) <Right-Click> to stop

Cue Indicator
A cue indicator lets you know that a cue is being used in the board. A solid indicator means that the cue is in the indicated state, while a flashing indicator means that the cue is currently fading into the indicated state.
  • Queued (playlist_play): this cue is loaded into memory and ready to play
  • Playing (play_arrow): this cue is currently playing
  • Paused (pause): this cue is paused and ready to play
  • Stopped (stop): this cue is stopped and will be removed soon
Queued Cues
All sound cues that have been queued are listed here. You can begin immediate playback of any by pressing play (play_arrow), or remove one from the queue by pressing unqueue (clear). Press [Spacebar] to begin playback of all cues in the queue.

Expand a cue for (keyboard_arrow_down) additional options: set the playback start time by clicking anywhere on the timeline, toggle looping (repeat) and fade-in (signal_cellular_4_bars) by clicking their icons, and adjust the playback volume using the volume controller (volume_up).
Playback Cues
All sound cues that are currently playing (or paused) are listed here. You can pause or resume playback of any by pressing pause (pause) or play (play_arrow), or stop them by pressing stop (stop). Press [Backspace] to stop playback of all cues in playback.

NOTE: Synthea will automatically fade out any cues when pausing or stopping.
Quick-Searching Cues

At any time, press [Tab] to bring up a cue search box. Type part of a cue name to see a list of matching cues in the project.

  • <Click> a cue to play it
  • <Click> a cue's queue icon (playlist_play) to queue it
  • [Up/Down] to highlight a cue in the list
  • [Enter] to play the highlighted cue
  • [Shift + Enter] to queue the highlighted cue
  • [Tab] to clear the search text
  • [Escape] to close the search box
DJ Mode

Synthea's "DJ Mode" provides randomized, seamless playback of all cues in a project. It's a good way to listen through every track for audio glitches, or to get into the headspace of a particular show.

Looping tracks will be looped for a reasonable time before changing, while non-looping tracks will play through. Once nearly every cue has been played, the randomization will start again.

Enable DJ Mode in the Synthea menu under Playback > DJ Mode. Stop DJ Mode by stopping the board ([Backspace] or Playback > Stop All).

Cloud Projects

To get familiarized with how Synthea works, a handful of my projects are available to stream. These include a variety of music, ambient, and effects boards—including some combinations of all three.

Cloud projects can be accessed in the Projects menu under Browse Cloud Projects…
